snippet: Even before the Postal Service begins closing hundreds of processing centers, some businesses say delays in mail delivery are costing them advertisers and subscribers.
abstract: Several businesses have already noticed a decline in service as the Postal Service prepares to close hundreds of processing centers to cut costs; post office notes that several factors have led to what it calls minor delivery delays, including machine breakdowns, time-consuming maintenance and consolidation of routes.
lead_paragraph: Even before the Postal Service begins closing hundreds of processing centers, some businesses say delays in mail delivery are costing them advertisers and subscribers.

headline.seo: Even Before Processing Centers Close, Postal Service Is Said to Be Declining
headline.main: With Cuts on the Way, Postal Service Customers Already Bemoan Delays
